Name: HMS Regulus
Fate: Sunk 6 December 1940 near Taranto, probably mined
Displacement:
1,763 long tons (1,791 t) surfaced
2,030 long tons (2,060 t) submerged
Propulsion:
Diesel-electric
2 × Admiralty diesel engines, 4,640 hp
2 × electric motors, 1,635 hp
2 shafts
Speed:
17.5 knots (20.1 mph; 32.4 km/h) surfaced
8.6 kn (9.9 mph; 15.9 km/h) submerged
Armament:
8 × 21 inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes (6 bow, 2 stern) with 14 reloads
1 × QF 4.7 in Mark IX deck gun
